title.rendered: “Decisive Night Operation: IDF Arrests 12 Suspects and Seizes Terrorist Funds in Judea, Samaria and Jordan Valley”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

IDF soldiers, Shin Bet and Border Police arrested last night 12 wanted suspects throughout Judea and Samaria and in the Jordan Valley and the Valleys Brigade.

The forces worked throughout the night in the refugee camp of Tulkarm in the Menashe Brigade and arrested four wanted individuals.

In the villages of Beit Ur al-Foka and Beit Ur al-Tahta in the Samaria Brigade and in the city of Jericho in the Jordan Valley and the Valleys Brigade, two more suspects were arrested.

Also, in Al-Mu’ayyir in the Binyamin Brigade, the soldiers arrested three wanted suspects involved in popular terrorism, and in the village of Sinjil in the brigade’s jurisdiction, three more wanted suspects were arrested alongside confiscated terrorist funds.

The arrested suspects and the seized terrorist funds have been transferred to the security forces for further treatment, our forces suffered no casualties.

So far, since the beginning of the war, over 3,050 suspects have been arrested throughout the Judea and Samaria Division and the Jordan Valley and Valleys Brigade, over 1,350 of them are affiliated with the Hamas terrorist organization.
